file_insights.details: Added aria-label='Toggle theme' to IconButton component for accessibility compliance
Updated task tracking from subtask 1-2 to 1-3, adjusted session number from 8 to 4, updated completion metrics (7/8 to 2/15)
Updated worktree and spec paths to reference new task 139 instead of task 017-1-2

patterns_discovered.description: Task focused on adding ARIA labels to improve component accessibility for screen readers
Large specification (15 total subtasks) being completed one component at a time with clear subtask tracking
Auto-claude system maintains session metadata, progress counters, and phase information automatically

gotchas_discovered.gotcha: Accessibility properties are simple but essential
gotchas_discovered.description: Single aria-label attribute provides significant accessibility value but can be easily overlooked without systematic review
Transition from previous task (017-1-2) to new task (139) shows system is managing multiple feature branches, requiring careful coordination

approach_outcome.details: Successfully added aria-label to ThemeToggle IconButton component. Single-line modification targeting accessibility compliance. Properly committed with auto-claude naming convention.

recommendations.suggestion: Consider creating a checklist for IconButton accessibility requirements (aria-label, aria-pressed for toggles, etc.) to ensure consistency across all 15 subtasks
Implement automated linting rules to detect missing aria-labels on interactive components to catch these issues proactively
Add accessibility testing using tools like axe-core or WAVE to verify aria-labels are properly exposed to assistive technologies
Document the aria-label naming convention being used across all IconButton components for consistency (e.g., 'Toggle theme' vs 'Toggle dark mode')
